snippet: Immigrants and their supporters gathered at rallies and news conferences in New York and across the nation to dispel rumors and to educate the immigrant population, as well as to buoy hope.
abstract: Immigrants gather at rallies in New York City and across the United States to protest court order halting Pres Obama's executive action on immigration; uncertainty surrounding programs, which would have potentially protected millions of undocumented immigrants from deportation, has prompted advocates to intensify outreach and educational efforts to their constituents.
lead_paragraph: Immigrants and their supporters gathered at rallies and news conferences in New York and across the nation to dispel rumors and to educate the immigrant population, as well as to buoy hope.

headline.main: In New York, Immigrants’ Advocates Vow to Fight After Judge Halts Obama Programs
headline.print_headline: Immigrants’ Advocates Vow to Fight After Judge Halts Obama Programs
